entries.title: Context Management in Python
entries.body:
When opening a file in Python, either to read or write, a context manager on the open() function should be used. The context manager will automatically close the filestream at the end of the code block, so the developer does not have to manually close (or forget to close) it. So instead of 

f = open('filename.txt','r')
stuff = f.read()
f.close()
it is better to do 
with open('filename.txt','r') as f:
    stuff = f.read()

entries.title: Never Learn CSS
entries.body: CSS is just awful. Let's all just make uninteresting webpages. Maybe go outside or something.
